title: Who originally performed the song 'Blue Moon'? - Quora

response.answer_text: The first person to record the song “Blue Moon” was Kenny Sargent, singing and playing the saxophone with Glen Gray and the Casa Loma Orchestra on November 16th, 1934.  A song with the same tune, but different title and lyrics, had been performed earlier the same year by Shirley Ross in the film Manhattan Melodrama. That version was called “The Bad in Every Man.”

"Blue Moon" is a classic tune written by Richard Rodgers and Lorenz Hart in 1934, and has become a standard ballad style song.. It may be the first instance of the familiar "50’s progression" in a popular song. The '50s progression is a progression and turnaround used in Western pop music. The progression, represented in typical Roman numeral analysis, is: I–vi–IV–V. For example, in C major: C–Am–F–G. As the name implies, it was common in the 1950s and early 1960s and is particularly associated with Doo-op and Be-bop.
